FuncDef:
The authentication keychain command configures keychain authentication to authenticate the connections between an AP and a master and between the primary and secondary masters.
The undo authentication keychain command restores the default configuration.
By default, no keychain authentication is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a keychain name, which is configured using the keychain command.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To prevent unauthorized user access and improve network security, run the authentication keychain command to configure keychain authentication to authenticate the connections between an AP and a master and between the primary and secondary masters.
Prerequisites
Virtual cluster access has been configured using the virtual-cluster-access command.
